title: Brian Edgar
text:
Brian Edgar (26 March 1936 – 5 October 2001) was an English <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a>, and professional <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who played in the 1950s and 1960s. He played club level rugby union (RU) for <a href="Workington%20RFC">Workington RFC</a><a href="http%3A//www.pitchero.com/clubs/workington/"></a>, and representative level rugby league (RL) for <a href="Great%20Britain%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Great Britain</a> (<a href="Captain%20%28sports%29">captain</a>), and <a href="England%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">England</a>, and at club level for <a href="Workington%20Town">Workington Town</a>, as a or , i.e. number 8 or 10, or, 11 or 12, during the era of contested <a href="Scrum%20%28rugby%29%23Rugby%20league">scrum</a>s.
Background.
Brian Edgar was born in <a href="Great%20Broughton%2C%20Cumbria">Great Broughton</a>, <a href="Cumberland">Cumberland</a>, England, and he died aged 65 in <a href="Seaton%2C%20Cumbria">Seaton, Cumbria</a>.
Playing career.
International honours.
Edgar won a <a href="Cap%20%28sport%29">cap</a> for <a href="England%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">England</a> (RL) while at Workington in 1962 against France, and won <a href="Cap%20%28sport%29">cap</a>s for <a href="Great%20Britain%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Great Britain</a> (RL) while at Workington in 1958 against Australia, and New Zealand, in 1961 against New Zealand, in 1962 against Australia (3 matches), and New Zealand, in 1965 against New Zealand, and in 1966 against Australia (3 matches).
Edgar and <a href="Leeds%20Rhinos">Leeds</a>' <a href="Joseph%20Thompson%20%28rugby%29">Joseph "Joe" Thompson</a> are the only <a href="Rugby%20league%20positions%23Forwards">Forwards</a> to be selected for three <a href="Australasia">Australasia</a>n tours.
Four Workington players were selected for the 1958 tour of Australia, and New Zealand; <a href="Harry%20Archer%20%28rugby%29">Harry Archer</a>, Brian Edgar, <a href="Ike%20Southward">Ike Southward</a> and <a href="Bill%20Wookey">Bill Wookey</a> (later of <a href="Barrow%20Raiders">Barrow</a>).
Challenge Cup Final appearances.
Brian Edgar played right-, i.e. number 12, in <a href="Workington%20Town">Workington Town</a>'s 12-21 defeat by <a href="Barrow%20Raiders">Barrow</a> in the <a href="1955%20Challenge%20Cup">1955</a> <a href="Challenge%20Cup">Challenge Cup</a> Final during the <a href="1954%E2%80%9355%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20League%20season">1954-55 season</a> at <a href="Wembley%20Stadium%20%281923%29">Wembley Stadium</a>, <a href="London">London</a> on Saturday 30 April 1955, in front of a crowd of 66,513, and played left-, i.e. number 11, in the 9–13 defeat by <a href="Wigan%20Warriors">Wigan</a> in the <a href="1958%20Challenge%20Cup">1958</a> <a href="Challenge%20Cup">Challenge Cup</a> Final during the <a href="1957%E2%80%9358%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20League%20season">1957–58 season</a> at <a href="Wembley%20Stadium%20%281923%29">Wembley Stadium</a>, <a href="London">London</a> on Saturday 10 May 1958.
Honoured at Workington Town.
Brian Edgar is a <a href="Workington%20Town">Workington Town</a> Hall Of Fame Inductee.
